title: Future in the Past
description: Слушайте о планах и предсказаниях, которые были в прошлом.

tasks.audioText: Last summer, we had big travel plans. We were going to visit Japan, but our flights got cancelled at the last minute.
tasks.transcript: We were going to visit Japan, but our flights got cancelled at the last minute.

options.text: They planned a trip to Japan but it didn't happen due to cancelled flights.
They successfully travelled to Japan last summer.
They cancelled their flights voluntarily.
They are currently planning to visit Japan next summer.

tasks.explanation: 'Were going to' expresses a plan that existed in the past but was not fulfilled. The cancelled flights prevented the trip.

tasks.audioText: Maria told me about her career plans at the party. She said she would apply for the manager position the following week.
tasks.transcript: She said she would apply for the manager position the following week.

options.text: Maria is applying for the position right now.
Maria stated her intention to submit an application for the managerial role.
Maria already got the manager position.
Maria decided not to apply for any positions.

tasks.explanation: 'Would' in reported speech represents a future intention viewed from the past. She expressed her plan to apply.

tasks.audioText: The forecast predicted heavy rain for the weekend. It was going to rain all day Saturday, so we changed our picnic plans.
tasks.transcript: It was going to rain all day Saturday, so we changed our picnic plans.

options.text: The expected rain caused them to alter their Saturday picnic arrangements.
They went on the picnic despite the rain forecast.
It rained on Sunday, not Saturday.
The weather was perfect for their picnic.

tasks.explanation: 'Was going to rain' indicates a prediction about the future made in the past. The expected rain led to a change of plans.

tasks.audioText: David had everything planned for his wedding anniversary. He was going to surprise his wife with a weekend getaway to Paris.
tasks.transcript: He was going to surprise his wife with a weekend getaway to Paris.

options.text: He surprised his wife with a trip to London.
His wife planned the surprise for him.
He had a plan to take his wife on a surprise trip to Paris.
He forgot about his wedding anniversary completely.

tasks.explanation: 'Was going to surprise' shows a past intention or plan. Whether it happened is uncertain, but the plan existed.

tasks.audioText: The tech company made a bold announcement last year. They claimed the new product would revolutionize the entire industry.
tasks.transcript: They claimed the new product would revolutionize the entire industry.

options.text: The company said their product was going to transform the whole industry.
The company admitted their product was a failure.
The product has already changed the industry completely.
The company is launching the product next year.

tasks.explanation: 'Would revolutionize' is the future in the past form, expressing a prediction made at an earlier time about what was expected to happen.

tasks.audioText: My sister was very excited about university. She told our parents she was going to study medicine and become a surgeon.
tasks.transcript: She told our parents she was going to study medicine and become a surgeon.

options.text: She informed her parents about her intention to pursue a medical career.
Her parents told her to study medicine.
She has already graduated from medical school.
She decided against studying medicine.

tasks.explanation: 'Was going to study' and 'become' express future plans as seen from the past. She shared her ambitions with her parents.

tasks.audioText: The coach had prepared an intense training schedule. He believed the team would win the championship that season.
tasks.transcript: He believed the team would win the championship that season.

options.text: The coach had no faith in the team's ability.
The team has already won the championship.
The coach was confident about the team's chances of becoming champions.
The coach decided to cancel the training schedule.

tasks.explanation: 'Would win' expresses the coach's past belief about a future outcome. He expected them to become champions.

tasks.audioText: I had an important meeting scheduled for Thursday morning. I was going to present the quarterly report to the board of directors.
tasks.transcript: I was going to present the quarterly report to the board of directors.

options.text: I planned to deliver the quarterly results to senior leadership.
I presented the report successfully on Thursday.
The board cancelled the quarterly report entirely.
Someone else was assigned to give the presentation.

tasks.explanation: 'Was going to present' indicates a planned action in the past. The speaker had the intention to deliver the report.

tasks.audioText: Emily looked at the old photographs from her childhood. She never imagined she would become a successful architect one day.
tasks.transcript: She never imagined she would become a successful architect one day.

options.text: She always knew she would be an architect.
She didn't expect that her future career would be in architecture.
She imagined becoming a doctor, not an architect.
She is still trying to become an architect.

tasks.explanation: 'Would become' shows an unexpected future outcome from a past perspective. She didn't foresee her architectural career.

tasks.audioText: The restaurant had received excellent reviews online. We thought it would be fully booked, but we managed to get a table.
tasks.transcript: We thought it would be fully booked, but we managed to get a table.

options.text: They expected no available tables, yet they found one.
The restaurant was indeed fully booked and they couldn't eat there.
They had a reservation at the restaurant.
They chose a different restaurant because of the reviews.

tasks.explanation: 'Would be fully booked' was their past expectation about the future. The reality was different: they got a table.

tasks.audioText: Before moving to London, Jake was nervous about the change. He wasn't sure he was going to adapt to the fast pace of life there.
tasks.transcript: He wasn't sure he was going to adapt to the fast pace of life there.

options.text: He was confident about adjusting to London quickly.
He had doubts about whether he could get used to London's lifestyle.
He decided not to move to London after all.
He had already adapted to London before moving.

tasks.explanation: 'Wasn't sure he was going to adapt' expresses uncertainty about a future outcome, viewed from the past.

tasks.audioText: The news reporter covered the election results live. Analysts predicted that the opposition party would gain a significant number of seats.
tasks.transcript: Analysts predicted that the opposition party would gain a significant number of seats.

options.text: Experts forecasted a substantial increase in seats for the opposition.
The opposition party lost all their seats in the election.
Analysts refused to make any predictions about the election.
The ruling party was expected to win every seat.

tasks.explanation: 'Would gain' is a past prediction about a future event. The analysts expected more seats for the opposition.

tasks.audioText: Sophie had been saving money for months. She was going to buy a new laptop for her university coursework.
tasks.transcript: She was going to buy a new laptop for her university coursework.

options.text: She already bought the laptop last month.
She planned to purchase a laptop for her studies.
She decided to spend the money on a holiday instead.
She borrowed a laptop from her friend.

tasks.explanation: 'Was going to buy' indicates a past intention. She had been saving money with the plan of getting a new laptop.

tasks.audioText: The construction company faced unexpected problems with the site. The project manager warned that the building would not be finished on time.
tasks.transcript: The project manager warned that the building would not be finished on time.

options.text: The manager assured everyone the building would be completed early.
The building was finished ahead of schedule.
The manager cautioned that the construction deadline would be missed.
The construction company abandoned the project entirely.

tasks.explanation: 'Would not be finished' expresses a negative future prediction from a past viewpoint. The manager expected delays.

tasks.audioText: When I was a child, my father often talked about space exploration. He always said that humans would live on Mars within his lifetime.
tasks.transcript: He always said that humans would live on Mars within his lifetime.

options.text: He never discussed space exploration with his children.
He repeatedly expressed his belief that people would colonize Mars during his life.
He thought Mars exploration was impossible.
Humans have already established colonies on Mars.

tasks.explanation: 'Would live' in reported speech shows a recurring past prediction about the future. He often shared this optimistic belief.

short_description: Будущее в прошедшем: was going to, would.
